caption: I stopped by to do some Christmas shopping for the tea enthusiast in my life, and I definitely stumbled across the right spot. I’m a total pleb when it comes to tea, and the people working there were a huge help picking something out while being 0% pretentious. Thanks!

Great coffee shop that offers my favorite drink - matcha latte. Service is one of the best I've experienced: super friendly and they even offered water for my dog :-)  I'm definitely a returning customer!
Cute shop, great variety, the barista really knows their products.
Really great. They teach you about the specific teas and the tea ceremony!
Interesting selection of tea, nice staff.
Favorite tea spot in the city. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly, the tasting classes are incredibly fun, and the tea is just dang good!

Very chill tea house right off the 606.  The tea tenders are extremely knowledgable and energetic -- definitely a big part of the whole experience.  BTW...this is a whole experience,  not just another cafe -- they do the whole Chinese or Japanese tea ceremony.  Its OK to bring your laptop and chill...you can spend hours leisurely sipping your way through a tea setting and chatting with the tea tenders.
Amazing service — all of the employees were friendly and knowledgeable. Very good tea and tea bites in a relaxing and trendy environment.
Excellent staff and excellent tea! Always enjoy coming here.
Lovely tea shop. Great teas. Friendly service. Very nice.
Favorite spot in the city for tea. Great atmosphere.
Artisanal-level brews with light snacking fare. The ceremonial aspect is a nice touch, well complemented by the knowledgeable staff
My favorite tea shop in Chicago. They quality of the tea is outstanding and the service there is A+
Had a great experience having the ceremonial matcha and chrysanthemum teas. The staff is also very friendly and knowledgeable, and help create a very welcoming atmosphere.
Tea is an art itself, so this is the right place for tea lovers! Five stars

Easthill is a fantastic destination for both avid tea-drinkers and people who can't tell sencha from matcha. The private tasting was an amazing tour of four different types of tea, some of which were recommended by our host. The tasting took about 1.5 hours, and included snacks such as cookies and mochi. During the tasting, our host Suzy taught us everything we could ever want to know about the tea process, from harvest to consumption rituals. She was incredibly friendly and got us excited to try the premium teas they reserve for tasting. Afterwards, they offered us 15% off on all their teas. I would highly recommend this place for non-tea drinkers as a place to try something new!
Best place to drink and learn about tea! Susie is amazing!

We stopped here before a White Sox game on a Saturday morning...bad idea, because I wanted to stay all afternoon! The whole vibe is incredibly chill and zen. I didn’t realize how much I needed (or would enjoy) this experience.  There are “fast” specialty options, like a rose latte or matcha latte, but the tea ceremony was my favorite part of our experience. Knowing nothing about traditional tea ceremonies, I didn’t know what to expect. The staff were super helpful, friendly, and conversational (if you ask questions and chat).  There is a wide range of black, white, green, and specialty teas. The helpful “tasting note” descriptions make it easier to find one that appeals to your preferences. After selecting your tea, they make it in small batches in front of you. You can stay for as many steeps as you’d like; we did three but wish we could’ve stayed for more. Each steep really did get more flavorful and enjoyable, as our helpful tea ceremonist (??) suggested. Ask about the tea pets because they’re so cute!  All in all, I thoroughly loved everything about this place and the encouragement to slow down, be mindful, and savor the craft of tea. Thank you for a great introduction to this cultural experience!

Why don’t more Americans drink high quality tea? Maybe it’s because people don’t want to mess with the temperatures or aren’t aware of just how good high quality leafs are.  Good news, Easthill Tea Co does all of this for you. Tea is steeped multiple times as it’s meant to be to draw out the complex layers of flavor in each type of leaf. There are lattes and iced tea available as well.  The workers are polite and pleased to have a chat with you about their teas.  The tea house has a bright and modern look like a new coffee house. I’ve been to China, and the quality of the tea and service rivals tea houses there. The owner travels to China to directly sample and source the teas.  I had a wonderful tea sampling while there. The tea house has classes and also can schedule tastings on request.
Amazing tea. Great staff. The experience is unique in Chicago.
Service, teas, and atmosphere is top notch here! Went for a tea tasting a year ago and can't stop coming back for their amazing teas and fantastic staff.
Tea house with limited seating.
Wide tea selection; friendly, knowledgeable but not overly tea-nerdy service; enjoyed the table tea service complete with tea animal; nice way to spend an hour or two with friends/family
Authentic Chinese tea. The owner is a friend of mine and he is from China. He is certainly the expert on Chinese tea.
Local favorite to grab and go.  I like the macadamia nut milk for latte's.  Waits are reasonable.
Great customer service and tea.  Loved the matcha lavender latte.

I got the Phoenix Single Bush tea and loving it! Beautiful and cozy place, very friendly staff, who took the time to welcome me and recommend certain teas, based of my favorite flavors. I can't wait to go back and try more kinds of tea. Highly recommend it!

The only CHINESE TEA CEREMONY in Chicago that is standard when you drink-in. 😊 My first and previous Chinese Tea Ceremony was in China 10+ years ago with a pee pee ceramic statue (Chinese thought it was funny for comedic presentation).  Now common, JAPANESE TEA CEREMONY is also performed here.  We just need a geisha to make it interesting. 😉  GRADE and PREP is important here!  NOT BRAND. For plain Cold Matcha, I automatically got Casual/Mid-Grade.
Very cozy and modern decor. Friendy staff. Tea always prepared carefully for best flavor.

I've wanted to go to Easthill for the longest time, when I did I was not disappointed. The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgable, they spent the time explaining about each type of tea, making, steeping and serving the tea. We ordered the tea flight for 2 starting woth rose tea followed by premium matcha and ending with pu-erh. We also ordered monkey bread on the side. Absolutely loved all types of tea we ordered, the flavors and temperatures were perfect and made me realize I've been drinking tea we rong all my life. Will definitely be back to try more flavors.

What an experience! We came an hour before closing when the busyness had died down and the servers were able to take the time to talk with us about the tea. They were very knowledgeable and helpful in recommending different teas for my husband and I. We throughly enjoyed our time here and would definitely return!!!
You can choose your tea animal!
A tea-obsessed friend and I did the flight tasting here and had a wonderful time. Easthill has a small but high quality of teas from Asia, very knowledgeable staff and wonderful atmosphere.

I'm so thrilled this place exists. I'm a huge fan of traditional tea preparation and I am grateful for the tea guides at east hill who take it as seriously as I do! The art displayed on the walls is great, the high end and entry level tea sets are displayed beautifully, and the atmosphere is inviting.
I am not a tea connoisseur but this place definitely ignites an interest. The tea was great and the staff great!
The best place to get quality tea!
Fantastic tea bar. The tea-tender was soo knowledgeable, kind, and patient. Great music, great decor, great vibe—great tea!!!
Great selection of teas, unique tea experience. Simple decor, knowledgeable staff. Highly recommend for tea lovers!
Incredible tea and atmosphere.  Very clean and a great space.  Music was chosen by workers which was at times a mismatch for a tea house (for us it was hard rock)
For the price yeah!!  definitely recommend this place. I took my friend her and she likes it. Im an avid tea drinker Im glad there’s good tea bar.
Beautiful and creative place
Very knowledgeable staff. Great service. Even better tea. I had a white pu-erh with my wife, who hates pu-erh, and we both enjoyed it. I think we got 6 steeps out of it and spent about 2 hours there.

LOVE the concept of this place. Went in off the 606 to get some tea not knowing it was a tea house. Will definitely be back to experience what it actually is as a tea house, however, I wasn't impressed with a $5 tea to go..

A wonderful selection of tea with a precise and informative staff. The tasting notes in the menu are spot-on as well. Absolutely give the Dragonwell green tea a try as well as the Moonlight White. And while this is primarily a tea place, the baked items up front are tasty too and are a great snack to have with your tea.
Such an amazing place.
Came here for a tea tasting and it was wonderful. Very knowledgeable staff, pure & organic tea. Great calming ambiance.. you have to go & enjoy
Very good place. The tea is very very good! I like the experience here!

The Tea Bar makes a great meeting space for conversation. I also really like the location. There is easy street parking with little foot traffic, which adds a feeling of exclusivity. The tea bar offers knowledgeable staff, and a simple, airy setting. However, I do wish the room temperature was more comfortable. I was there for two hours and felt cold even while drinking the tea, which was lukewarm.
Great spot for a spot of authentic tea! None of the blended tea nonsense..

Very knowledgeable staff and the menus are incredibly thorough—you can learn a lot just reading through it. The most interesting thing about this place is how the tea is served, which is in a very traditional chinese way. Haven’t met the owner yet, but it’s cool to see their story in the menu as well. Also I’m writing this at 4:30am and I have no idea if it’s because I’m still buzzing from the caffeine of the tea
Best tea in Chicago!
Lovely place with lovely staff. Can't recommend enough.
THE best tea shop/ tea bar in Chicago! Very knowledgeable, friendly, and above all, delicious teas!

The tea was delicious and the service was some of the best I've ever received. The staff is knowledgeable about every aspect of the tea making process and super super friendly and helpful. I don't live in Chicago, but will definitely be coming back the next time I visit. Compared to similar tea houses I've been to in New York, this is also about 1/2 or 1/3 of the price. Highly recommend!
Lots of tasty tea options and slow, thoughtful ceremonies. Pretty expensive, but it makes sense with how much time they take.
I had a very relaxing and educational experience here. In addition, the tea was pure, unprocessed, and smooth. I highly recommend checking out Tea Bar.
Very hip
Great Tea! Great People! Great Place!

Wrapping up a wonderful early afternoon tea session as I write this. Super comfortable place to plug in for a while, and the tea is great. Definitely recommend no matter your comfort level or knowledge of tea, as the staff are super informative and educational.

Xuan Tea is lovely! I was there couple of times now and keep coming back even though I live pretty far from Wicker Park. It's a hidden gem. A good vibe, excellent service and I ever made couple of friends there :) Tea selection is great, and their matcha is just incredible. My go to spot with friends or alone. Try it out!

This place was awesome and a great addition to the neighborhood. I stopped by for their soft opening and felt at home. I am not a big tea drinker, but the girl & guy (Will) behind the counter explained everything in detail and made me feel at home. I tried a bunch of teas and really loved them all. I experienced my first tea ceremony and thought it was great. I'll be coming back!

An absolute hidden gem in Wicker Park. Fantastic service and a great selection of delicious teas. The shop is beautiful as well and has plenty of space to hang with friends or settle in to get some work done. Highly recommend!
